original: Åkesson, Nils Johan, lasarettsläkare, Finspång, f. 25/10/95 i Gbg av lärov:-adj. Jöns Å. o. Hanna Larsson. G. 23 m. med. lic. Hilda Bengtsson. Barn: Bengt-Åke f, 24, med. kand., Ingrid 30, Karin 39. — Stud :ex. i Gbg 14, med. kand. 18 o. med. lic. 24 i Lund. Div. förordn. v. klin. o. las. 20-25, tf. und:-läk. v. Landskr. o. Trelleb. las. samt e. läk. v. röntgenklin. i Lund 26, andre und :läk. v. Falu las. kir. avd. 27-30, därunder vik. förste und’:’läk. sexton mån., tf. las :läk. i Avesta 30, tf. aman. o. tf. und:läk. v. Maria sjukh. kir. klin. s. å., aman. där 31, därunder tf. un-diläk. åtta mån., tf. und:läk. där samt e. o. aman. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. öronpoliklin. 32, e. läk. v. Maria sjukh. kir. klin. 33, und:läk. där 33-38, därunder vik. överläk. åtta mån., und:-läk. v. med. avd. där 38-39, förste und :läk. o. bitr. las :läk. v. Falu las. kir. avd. 39, las :läk. i Finspång sed. 43’. Bat:läk. i Fik res. 27.
translated:
Åkesson, Nils Johan, hospital physician, Finspång, born on October 25, 1895 in Gothenburg, son of secondary school teacher Jöns Å. and Hanna Larsson. Married since 1923 to medical licentiate Hilda Bengtsson. Children: Bengt-Åke, born in 1924, medical candidate; Ingrid, born in 1930; Karin, born in 1939. 

Education: Graduated from secondary school in Gothenburg in 1914; medical candidate in 1918; medical licentiate in 1924 from Lund University. Various appointments as clinical and hospital physician from 1920 to 1925, acting assistant physician at Landskrona and Trelleborg hospitals; radiology physician in Lund in 1926; second assistant physician at Falun Hospital surgical department from 1927 to 1930, including a temporary position as first assistant physician for sixteen months; acting hospital physician in Avesta in 1930; assistant physician and temporary acting assistant physician at Maria Hospital surgical clinic in the same year, assistant physician there in 1931, including a temporary position as assistant physician for eight months; assistant physician and temporary acting assistant physician at Sabbatsberg Hospital ear clinic in 1932, assistant physician at Maria Hospital surgical clinic in 1933, assistant physician there from 1933 to 1938, including a temporary position as acting senior physician for eight months; assistant physician at the medical department there from 1938 to 1939, first assistant physician and deputy hospital physician at Falun Hospital surgical department in 1939; hospital physician in Finspång since 1943. Military: Battalion physician in the Field Reserve in 1927.

appointments.description: Assistant physician and temporary acting assistant physician
Assistant physician and temporary acting assistant physician
First assistant physician and deputy hospital physician
